review_title: Great game with one major flaw
one_reviews_text:
REZ is a classic and the star of the game is undoubtedly the newely added Area X with its gorgeous visualization.

The problem with the 5 "classic" levels is that the objects are rendered at 60 FPS while the Rift is running the game at 90 FPS. This is causing some slight stuttering with all of the moving objects and enemies. 
It isn't a gamebreaking but for me quite distracting and disappointing. Area X is not affected by this, as it was build up from the ground for VR. 
I doubt it, but I still hope that there will be fix in the future.

I've played this game on two previous platforms.  That should make it clear that the game itself is good enough to keep it in your library, even when you upgrade to the new hardware generation.  Would that be enough to justify repurchasing it once again just to play in VR?  Normally the answer would be no.  A resolution upgrade is one thing, especially for those of us who have 8 bit origins, but a VR upgrade is typically lackluster and disappointing.  This upgrade won't blow your VR mind but there is something worth investigating.  I will admit my review is shaded by my initial experience of the game and the nostalgia that brings... but Arena X  changed my mind.  I honestly can't put my finger on what it was that changed my mind per se.  Playing the game in VR felt new again even though it wasn't revolutionary. There are moments in Area X where I .....
Frankly it was like talking to an old friend who had new stories to tell.  That being said I have to address my rating.  I will rate this one as a 4 officially for new players.  If you have played this game on other platforms I am sure you'll understand why the upgrade only gets 3.  That being said...  I'd buy it all day every day.  I would just temper my expectations going in.

The original Rez is already an awesome experience in music and synethesia, but the new Area X is simply beyond words! If you are a fan of the original Rez, you owe it to yourself to get this to experience it for yourself.

Please, need more Area X style content!

(UPDATE - Targeting indicators are now plain white squares as if something is missing? What happened, kind of broke it for me, so distracting, makes me keep thinking, "what is that?") back to 4 starts until the targing indicators are fixed, thanks.)
Said WOAH ! at least 6 times, so giving this a 6 WOAH ! rating. (this was before they updated the targeting indicator that kind of broke it for me, PLEASE Fix)

Yes agree with WesleySnipers, area X expansions DLC would be great.

I also streamed my own music play list , but can still hear the sound FX mixed in, very cool atmosphere, great psychedelic stuff !

Tip : Alternate quickly between X and A fire buttons to save you repetitive motion.
This is the game I've been waiting for since watching Lawnmower Man in 1992.

I don't know the desktop version, but this in VR is just a wonderful experience. Playing the game is very intuitive: Actually, I have no idea what I'm doing, but it's fun! Flying around in this literally "virtual" reality, pointing at things that explode in a sea of fireworks. This is going to be one of my favorite places in VR to relax.
Please we need an area x expansion....

Words can barely describe how incredible this title is - this game is utterly perfect for VR. It gives you that 'looking forward to the future' feel, of awe and delight! It's a stylised and abstract vision from the 90s (pre original Rez) like what we might've imagined of a VR future might be back then, even harking back further to the original TRON movie. 
It sure beats all your standard VR stationary/teleport shooting games (except maybe Robo-Recall). I've just come out of my first session (unfortunately it crashed or I'd still be in it!) having played both Rez and Rez X sections, and I'm blown away. I'm sure I don't stand alone when I say to the devs - MORE PLEASE! We'll all pay!
Rez Inf. ist das erste Spiel bei dem ich keine Motionsickness bekomme! Macht echt Spaß das Game und die Musik dazu ist top!

I played this back in the day on PS2 and it floored me then. I always thought it was ahead of it's time and that the gaming interface back then held it back. However VR is how this is meant to be played. Outstanding work of art!!!

review_title: Favourite game ever made even better
one_reviews_text: Rez is an all time classic for me. The first game of it's kind to integrate visuals, sound, and tactile feedback into, IMHO, a masterpiece. This is how I felt for the first iteration of it on Dreamcast/PS2, which was made even better with RezHD on Xbox360/PS3. I've since moved on from consoles to PC gaming, where I've been gaming in 3D for years via Nvidia 3DVision hardware. It's been a long time dream to experience Rez in glorious 3D for so long that I thought that dream was lost, and almost forgotten, but then one day I log onto my PC and find Rez Infinite available for purchase in VR and was an instant buy. The launch was a bit rocky, due to bad 3D implementation, causing me to initially rate this 2 out of 5 (because I was literally that disappointed), but first they updated Area X, which was nice, but what I really wanted was to experience the main game that I love in 3D, and after some time the developers managed to implement the 3D strength option, which has finally made my dream come true. There are a couple of minor issues, like a slight skip in the music between stages, but other than that this is one of best experiences available today.

I've always loved rez but to me this felt a little underwhelming compared to the games we have now.  The graphics and music surely could of had a revamp but they still look the same as previous versions and somehow if they could of implemented both touch controllers, instead of just one, this would of also added to the immersion and I found a lot of the time the target wasn't keeping up with my hand movements and I felt like I was aiming in completely the wrong direction and I've got 4 sensors and every other game, my tracking is perfect!

EDIT I realised the tracking isn't off, it's the fact that moving your hand and your controller both control the target which is frustrating as I want to move my head around but it interferes with me targeting, devs: please give an option to just either use your touch controller or head to move your target around and not both at the same time, would be much easier

I had never played rez before, but I often heard reviews being overwhelmingly positive about the game. After having played it, I totally understand why. Even though the game is short, it is a great VR experience. The music, the good pace and the cool art-style make this game immersive (even without hyperrealistic graphics.) The fact that it's short, shouldn't be a problem, you should compare it to a really good song that you want to hear over and over again. I am sure that I'll play through it multiple times.

review_title: area x is fantastic, but wayyy too short
one_reviews_text:
the old rez on vr was cool enough, until i tried area x... now, in all honesty, its hard to play through the old levels, they pale in comparison. the new built-for-vr area x level is GORGEOUS, absolutely a must play. but unfortunately it's just one level, and not worth the price merely for that.

i really do hope that they make more levels. and also, i hope other vr developers take note of the success of rez vr and try it out themselves, so they can see how vr can open up experiences that transcend dated gaming genres. we should be trying new things that make sense for vr, not merely trying to recreate what has worked in 2d!

review_title: Area X Is The Best Part
one_reviews_text: So Rez is an old game, but there is an extra mode in this version called "Area X". It blows the original game out of the water. I played around with the main game for a bit, and its pretty good. Area X, though is phenomenal. Its unfortunate that it is so short, but I want to go back into it again because its so good.
Launched it just to try it out. Ended up playing through in one sitting.

I under stood the reason for the sale.
This has already been little older.
Little refreshing and acomplishment feeling.
I recommend sound game like AIRTONE.

review_title: Too dated, not good enough for VR.
one_reviews_text:
I love Rez, having played it Sega Dreamcast back in the noughties. It was a great game, back then. This been adapted to VR without any thought about it. Having a 3rd person perspective kills the immersion straight away, and there is no option for 1st person.
The music is also dated, sounding very tinny and 90's. And the graphics have also not aged well.
Even with Touch support (you can only use one touch controller) the gameplay is very tedious, it is after all just a wave shooter on rails. When converting games like Battlezone to VR, the developers didn't do a straight port - they updated the game to fit the times. No such thought has gone into this. If you are curious best to wait until this is down to below £5, but you will still feel a little underwhelmed even at that price.
A masterpiece

review_title: A psychadelic masterpiece, then and now
one_reviews_text:
Rez's combination of abstract, stylized visuals, melodic sound design, and rhytmic gameplay pacing are even more compelling in VR than they were on the Dreamcast back in 2001. It's always been the sort of game you have to give yourself over to, and VR makes it that much easier to lose yourself in the sights and sounds. 


This release also features a pretty important addition, a new level called Area X that is, in fact, much more than just an extra stage. It's essentially a mini-sequel that features modern graphics, a new engine, and free-roaming gameplay different from the original. This stage is beautiful, and after beating it for the first time, I found it genuinely overwhelming, in the best possible way. It wrecked me for a few minutes. I know that's not an experience that will happen for everyone and I'm sure it's not something I could replicate, but it was one of the best moments in gaming I've ever had. 

VR is already an inherently pretty psychadelic medium, essentially an artificial hallucination, but Rez uses that to define a world in which you can paint the sky with music, and this release proves it's a true masterpiece.

I cannot imagine having played Area X any other way.. The simplest way to describe my experience is that of experiencing nirvana in the purest essence of the word. By the end of Area X, I was legit crying my eyes out. 

It was a legit religious experience that I am so happy to have witnessed. For that moment where I was in Area X, I forgot I was standing inside my room and thought to myself this is what inner peace feels like. 

It was glorious!

review_title: Not as good as PSVR version(no 3D depth)
one_reviews_text:
Problems reported on many forums : there is no stereoscopic effect in RezX both eyes are the same. PSVR had a full 3D effect like all VR games, but there is definitely a problem on the rift.

There is almost zero 3D effect, like everything is too far, so you feel like it's a 2D game projected into a 360 sphere. The PSVR version had much more colors and the 3D depth was fully there. So all the particles are now uninteresting because they are flat and far away. Many things are different, the soundfx don't sound the same and the game is a little bit slower and there are little hesitation into the music and the sounds. My pc performance has nothing to do with it, trust me. But the game is worth it anyway if far from the playstation VR version.

This is awesome. One of my favourite games of all time, I still listen to the original soundtrack and the Gamers Guide remixes on a regular basis. VR does sort of reduce the challenge from the normal levels, and it's a shame that it has to be restricted to 60 fps, but it's still amazing. The new level is just incredible, I want a whole game like that. The only thing that could possibly make this better would be support for the original USB Trance Vibrator (I have two of them from the PS2 version, the rumble in ordinary controllers doesn't compare). This is the fourth time I've bought this game over the years, please patch in some Trance Vibrator support for this version :-)

review_title: Beautiful. A bit simple. I want more.
one_reviews_text: Area X is the most beautiful thing I've ever experienced in VR. Breath taking. Gave me chills. Don't expect super deep gameplay, and I wish there was way more of it... but yes it's worth the money and this will be my go-to "demo" game from now on.

Area X was amazing. The music, the graphics, the rithm, it was so calming, relaxing and fun. The emotions it sterred in me were so powerful that I simply can not describe them in mere words. But I was crying of joy at the end, so sad that it was so short.
Even without the butt rumble attachment, this is by far the most immersive version of Rez. I'm sure you could sit on a touch controller or something if you really miss that from the Dreamcast days.

I absolutely loved the concept of the game, the animations, sounds, etc.  However, as someone sensitive to motion sickness, this game is anything but 'Comfortable' as a rating, and I suspect many others as sensitive as I am would agree. 

Again, amazing game though!  I just wish I had stronger VR legs. ;-)

review_title: This is by far not worth the money
one_reviews_text: I don't get the hype from the other reviews. I got dizzy rather fast, the "gameplay" seems non existent and I really hope that Oculus Support will accept my refund request. The 3D effect was also missing big time. It seemed more like a non-3D 360 "experience" than a true 3D VR "game".

I feel like this is one of those "important" VR games we will remember years from now. The combination of trippy visuals and music based gameplay makes it a unique experience everyone should at least try. Inspiring stuff!

On a side note: The game has received regular updates after launch based on user feedback, which is refreshing coming from such a big developer. 

I sincerely hope they make more of this!
Yes. They went and did it. Need I say more? If you're into the original or on rails shooters in general this is what you've been waiting for.

Feels like Rez is finally in the virtual reality place it was always meant to be in! :) Considering the game wasn't initially designed with VR in mind all those years ago, it holds up pretty ok in terms of the mechanics. Only slight problem is that it's a bit too easy now with Touch controllers compared to the old Sony PS2 dual sticks I used when it first came out. But hey, it's still a great ride anyway!

review_title: Not in 3D, no depth to the graphics
one_reviews_text: I don't think it's just me either. It looks flat. There is no option to increase stereo separation in the settings either. I didn't buy VR to play flat games. Will adjust review when 3D is fixed.

If you played and enjoyed the original Rez, this is absolutely amazing. If you have no emotional connection to the original, you might want to think twice before you buy, because it looks and plays (mostly) like a 90's game.

review_title: Shooting bubbles with a laser pointer...
one_reviews_text:
After 1 minutes I was concerned...
After 2 minutes I was looking for something positive to feel about the game...
After 3 minutes I was feeling bored...
After 4 minutes I was feeling sick...
After 5 minutes I was annoyed and asking for my money back.

It feels (to me at least) like an early title I would have tried on my DK1.

REZ is a game that you either love or hate. There is no between. And not everyone gets caught by its magic.

To make it short: if you know and loved the previous releases on DC, PS2 or Xbox360 then BUY IT ! Its the best version you can get.

All the others should check atleast some gameplay videos before purchasing.

To the developer: please, PLEASE announce a VR-Version of "Child of Eden" ! Make the VR synesthesia experience complete !

My original review stated that the game wouldn't launch, but after updating my video drivers, the game ran perfectly. Very fun. I think the price is fair, and it's certainly fun enough for replay value. Also, it's easy enough to learn that any non-gamers in your house can have fun with it, too.

This is probably not a game for everyone – you might want to avoid it if you dislike retro shooters, or if you are one of those people that is overly concerned with “value” and wants all their games to have dozens of hours of gameplay. That said, I personally found ‘Rez Infinite’ an absolute joy to play. The original game is still amazing, and is one of the best examples of how to combine graphics, music and gameplay to create a unique artistic experience. Area 5 is still one of the coolest final levels in any game. Apart from a couple of short segments with awkward camera angles, the VR version is undoubtedly the best way to play the game – the enhanced sense of scale is mindblowing, particularly during the layer transitions. The new ‘Area X’ level is also beautiful. I hope Tetsuya Mizuguchi continues to work with VR – I’d love to see ‘Child of Eden’ reworked in VR as well, or maybe even a completely original project...

I (as many of you may have too) have had this game for years, i still come back to it frome time to time on the xbox and love it.
Its now on the rift?! im giving 5 stars while its downloading, havent played it yet and i dont think i will need to edit this rating as: AWESOME and a MUST have. WOOP!
Update: 5 stars. Thank you for giving us Rez. It's one of my all time favorite games. Played the $#&@ out of it on PS2. And thanks for listening to us.

review_title: Remake the Way The Original Was Meant
one_reviews_text:
Since it was always about "entering cyberspace".

The action ( what you do as player ) is a bit limited on the classic game levels,
new users ( who didn't play it on Playstation etc. ) may want to check out "Area X" first!

That said, in Area X, the "goal" of the levels are much less obvious, it will take some exploration!   I hope there is a lot of new content in there, and it's cool that they added it.

It's a quality game, but might want to lower the price, as retro titles often do.

From playing rez on the PS2 then Dreamcast then onto the Xbox360 you can say i sort of like it.
So when a see this version it was an instant purchase, it has great sound and visuals in VR mode and what can a say about Area X just awesome.Don't forget your vr legs you will need them.

Original rez is good, but Arena X just blew me away! I wish there was more levels like this! Awesome, but pricy for how quickly you gonna finish it. With touch it is super easy, so if you want a chalange play with a controller or something (does not apply to Arena X, don't think it was meant to be challanging).
Strong 4 stars from me.

review_title: Just buy it. And bring on Child of Eden!
one_reviews_text: This is so awesome. Rez was one of my favorite games of all time back on the Dreamcast. And I am so glad that, now, that first version (although a great game for the time) just feels as an early prototype of this VR one. I am aware that the "Infinite" version was out for some time, but I am happy I skipped it. So the impact now is really huge. And I am sure that Child of Eden (from the same game creator) will follow soon. What I wish for though, and probably will not happen, is they came up with a Space Channel 5 VR version (from the same creator also, and also great).

The game is very simple arcade shooter, the visuals are ok retro look but tbh nothing really that special. Music was pretty avarage 90s techno, sounds like kid did with not much talent on fruity loops. I don't get what the fuss is & not worth the asking price.

The gameplay is dated along with the graphics.  There is hardly any immersion. The fun factor is 3 out of 5 at best. It's sad that there's no way to refund this game if you're not in the UK.  I might be buying my games from Steam whenever possible from now on.
This game is one of my favorite rail shooters ever.  Bought it on PS4 but couldn't play it in VR.  So happy to see it finally on PC and on Oculus.  Bought it the second I found out.

review_title: I mean... i get it.... but...
one_reviews_text: I'd be happy if this was 10 bucks.... I mean its cool, the area x is TRIPPY!!! and the music is pretty cool. Its good...its just more of an experience than a game in my opinion, like its not really fun to play or challenging, its just kinda cool in an artistic way.

review_title: This is why I bought into VR
one_reviews_text:
Played this to death on the PS2  and always thought this would be an amazing VR game, It really is.
Make sure to change that control scheme to motion controller only though because the default settings lock to your head movement and will cause you to miss when you look around...
The classic levels doesn't run at 90hz - it looks like every other frame is shown twice. Come on devs - you can do better!

Loved this game all those years ago on my Dreamcast. 

So how can you make a great game even better?  Stick it into VR of course and then play with the volume up to max.  

Haven't even tried out Area X yet, going to play through the standard game again first.

Had inital problems with launch version (black screen, game didn't load) - contacted developer which responded quickly! With patch v1.7, game now runs perfectly.  AREA X is now my showcase title to show people what VR was really made for!

Can someone tell me where is the free DLC on my PC or how to get the DLC ? Many thanks !!
P.-S. Can someone/developer answer please? I feel like i've been screwed with the DLC bait !!
review_feedback: It's in the same folder as the game in installed (likely found at "Program Files > Oculus > Software > "), but you can just search for the folder "Digital Deluxe Bonus Extras" and find it that way.

one_reviews_text: Saw a lot of the hype going down on reddit.. never played the original games or the ps4 version. This game would sit next to Robo Recall and Echo Arena if I had a shelf for my virtual games.
Game never loads, no error nothing!
review_feedback:
We apologize for the issues you are encountering and hope to resolve this as 
quickly as possible.  

We would appreciate your help in sharing your OS/CPU/GPU/display monitor set up so we can take a closer look.  

Thank you again and we will keep you posted with any updates.

one_reviews_text: I had no idea this was coming to Oculus. I thought I would never get to play it. Bought it tonight and played through the whole thing. Great music and just a fun world to travel through!
Not stereoscopic 3D. Feels like playing a 360 video. Kinda fun otherwise, but the lack of 3D is disappointing.
Another one who can't get the game to launch. No way to get a refund either. I feel cheated.
review_feedback:
Thank you for the info and your patience! We are working on a solution -- in the meantime, can you try these two things? 

1. Nvidia control panel > manage 3D settings > and under "preferred graphics processor" selecting "high performance nvidia processor", then apply.
2. NVidia Panel Control > select Rez.exe to run with the dedicated GPU.

If those don't work, can you let us know your OS, CPU, and GPU?

one_reviews_text: I never played the 2D version and now I am glad I waited. This game is gorgeous with an outstanding soundtrack. I plan on losing myself in this game many times.

review_title: Finnaly a classic has come to PC VR
one_reviews_text: Ignore the fact that this is a "rail shooter", this is a game aboout style. I put the headset on and just listen to the music and get lost in the visuals.

review_title: Best Experience I´ve EVER FEEL IN LIFE!
one_reviews_text: This was the best visualization of my "consciousness" I´ve ever seen/feel/realized so far. Great Thanks! We´ll stay in contact.
VR is a psychedelic. Area X is the proof.  Bringing Love and Light your way.  Polish the lenses before use.  Become the music.
Well, I find it pretty awesome, especially Area X in VR. Very short, very easy, but man, it's a fun ride.
This is a great game. I want to see more games like this. It plays to a rythm and to a tune. VR party here I come!
The Old REZ. Nice. The new REZ is awesome but done in just 15 minutes.

Had this on PSVR , this is simple yet beautiful
great music that follows the game, and area X well you have to see it
Super trippy, fun gameplay, great music. This is one of my favorite VR experiences to date.
It's awesome that they finally brought this from PSVR. A taste of hopefully what will come with a full game
I played it on Dreamcast and i loved it. I was so happy to see it released on Oculus. Its amazing!

review_title: Best reason to own a Rift
one_reviews_text:
this is why I bought a Rift. 
Area X is worth the price alone
I think i'll never been tired of playing this in VR. Love it!
If the matrix and psychedelics made a baby this game would be it.
love it
Pretty cool, but new RezX level hurt my eyes/headache
Excellent port, must have for fans of the original
Fun frenetic game.
If the matrix and psychedelics made a baby this game would be it.
love it
Pretty cool, but new RezX level hurt my eyes/headache
Excellent port, must have for fans of the original
Fun frenetic game.
